alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 23 at 12:25PM MST until August 24 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River Near Gila River near Solomon affecting Graham County. For the Upper Gila...Gila River near Solomon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Gila River Near Gila River near Solomon. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Agricultural flooding begins from Solomon down to Thatcher. Water begins to threaten bridge approaches in the Safford Valley. At 22.5 feet, Bridges in Safford Valley closed and extensive agricultural flooding. Homes and structures closest to the river threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:41 AM MST Tuesday the stage was 19.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10 AM MST Tuesday was 22.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to stay below flood stage through the remainder of today into Wednesday morning with some occasional rises expected due to thunderstorm activity over the next 12 to 18 hours. Overall the water level is expected to fall to 12.0 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1130 AM MST.
